chargeHist.descr: Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm (939.63(1)(c) Use of a Dangerous Weapon)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor Darvell McKnight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Upon revocation, defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
TERMS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with 1724 South 7th Street (laundromat), 1710 W Mitchell (dentist office,) Mary R., Dawn E.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Obtain Mental health assessment and take all prescribed medications.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. And pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over period of probation; any balance converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation, through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant. Restitution set at zero.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.

timeConds.notes: At the discretion of the Department. Huber for treatment conditional upon absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions filed and signed by the Court.  IT IS ORDERED:  That a commitment be issued forthwith directing the Sheriff of Milwaukee County to take the said Defendant into custody to spend 9 MONTHS straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said Defendant's non-compliance with the aforementioned condition of probation.  Copies forwarded to parties.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Pocan
for review. os

Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.

Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in court with attorney Richard L Voss.  Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS 6 months,  with credit for 50 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 months; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years.  This sentence is stayed and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 3 years.  Upon revocation, the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of probation and extended supervision:
-serve 9 months in the House of Correction; At the discretion of the Department, Huber for treatment conditional upon absolute sobriety.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Obtain Mental health assessment and take all prescribed medications.
No contact with 1724 South 7th Stree(laundromat), 1710 W Mitchell (dentist office) Mary R, Dawn E.
Restitution set at zero
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--to be paid over period of probation; any balance converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation, through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over period of probation; any balance converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation, through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in court with attorney Richard L Voss.  Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Count 2:  Dismissed and read-in
Count 1:  Penalty enhancer dismissed.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Scott Voeks-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-01-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dawn E.  AND/OR  Mary R.   AND/OR  Jose R.   AND/OR  their residences   AND/OR  their places of employment
Further, No Contact with the addresses of:  710 West Mitchell Street    AND/OR  1724 South 7th Street

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION and Electronic Monitoring.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Drug Testing.  Breathalyzer Tests.  Absolutely No Release from home.

No firearms 
No dangerous weapons

Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in court with Attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Victor Darvell McKnight in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant entered a plea of Not Guilty as to Count 2.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
